001package imagingbook.lib.util.bits;
002
003public interface BitVector {
004        
005        /**
006         * Returns {@code true} is the specified element is set (1),
007         * {@code false} otherwise (0).
008         * @param i the element index
009         * @return as described
010         */
011        public boolean get(int i);
012        
013        /**
014         * Sets the specified bit-element to the given boolean value
015         * (1 for {@code true}, 0 for {@code false}).
016         * @param i the element index
017         * @param val a boolean value
018         */
019        public default void set(int i, boolean val) {
020                if (val) 
021                        this.set(i);
022                else
023                        this.unset(i);
024        }
025        
026        /**
027         * Sets the specified element (to bit-value 1).
028         * @param i the element index
029         */
030        public void set(int i);
031        
032        /**
033         * Unsets the specified element (to bit-value 0).
034         * @param i the element index
035         */
036        public void unset(int i);
037        
038        /**
039         * Sets all element values to 1.
040         */
041        public void setAll();
042        
043        /**
044         * Sets all element values to 0.
045         */
046        public void unsetAll();
047        
048        /**
049         * Returns the length of this bit vector.
050         * @return the length of this bit vector
051         */
052        public int getLength();
053        
054        /**
055         * Factory method. Creates and returns a new bitvector of type
056         * {@link BitVector64}.
057         * @param length the length of the bit vector
058         * @return a new bit vector
059         */
060        public static BitVector create(int length) {
061                return new BitVector64(length);
062        }
063
064}
